info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 1 at 6:01PM MST until September 1 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona...
* Until 700 PM MST.
* At 601 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Phoenix International Raceway to El Mirage to 7 miles northwest of Peoria, moving west at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 108 and 152. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 226. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 4.
Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Peoria, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Tolleson, Youngtown, Sun City West, Waddell, Laveen, Cashion, and Circle City.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
